{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about a continuous murmur that can be heard in all except one option. The options are related to congenital heart defects or fistulas. A VSD (ventricular septal defect) with aoic regurgitation typically produces a holosystolic murmur, not a continuous murmur. Coronary AV fistula and Pulmonary AV fistula can also produce different types of murmurs, but not continuous murmurs. Patent ductus aeriosus is the most likely option to produce a continuous murmur.", "answer_choice": "D"}
